business.headline: US Fed chair signals possible September rate cut, cites rising job market risksUS Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell's comments open the door to a rate cut at the Fed's September 16-17 meeting, but also put heavy weight on jobs and inflation reports that will be received before then.

Planning Europe trip? Schengen visa hike may upset your trip budgetThe Schengen visa allows travellers to visit 29 European countries for up to 90 days within a 180-day period. Applicants must submit standard documents, including travel plans, insurance, and financial proof.

Sebi strikes at finfluencer Avadhut Sathe's Karjat Trading AcademyThe action followed complaints that penny stocks were being promoted during his training sessions, allegedly presented as classroom examples while encouraging students to invest.

Which bank offers higher 1-year FD? See rates from HDFC, ICICI, SBI and 3 othersMost lenders usually announce similar interest rates on one-year deposits, making it seem as if there isn't much of a difference in where you invest. However, a closer look at the latest rates reveals small but meaningful variations.

Sensex closes 694 points lower, Nifty below 25,000; Asian Paints down 2%The S&P BSE Sensex closed 694 points lower at 81.306.85 points, while the NSE Nifty50 declined by 213.65 points to end at 24,870.10.

This investor cut his Rs 10 lakh tax bill to 0. Here's howMany taxpayers assume that once the financial year ends, their chance to save tax is gone.and Ramesh was no exception. But instead of rushing, he used a little-known route that brought his tax bill down to nothing.

Dalal Street gears up for busy week with 5 market debuts, 2 IPOs in pipelineMangal Electrical Industries is set to debut on August 28 after finalising its allotment on August 25. Patel Retail, Vikram Solar, Gem Aromatics, and Shreeji Shipping Global will all list on August 26.

Wealthy Asian families bet big on crypto: ReportThe growing interest comes as Bitcoin recently hit an all-time high of over $124,000. New rules, such as Hong Kong's stablecoin legislation and the United States' GENIUS Act, have further boosted confidence in the sector.

Real-money gaming ban rocks advertising, sports sponsorships: What's at stake?The rise of money-based platforms created billions in advertising spend, now facing a sudden halt. This article examines how the ban on real-money gaming is reshaping India's advertising, sports sponsorships, and emerging e-sports opportunities.

Credit score confusion: Is CIBIL transparent enough in deciding your financial fate?The credit score by CIBIL can decide whether someone gets a car loan, a home loan, or even a credit card. Yet, very few actually know how CIBIL works or who controls it.

ITR filing 2024–25: Comparing deductions under old and new tax regimeFiling your Income Tax Return for FY 2024–25? Before you decide on old or new tax regime, it's important to know how deductions differ. The right choice could help reduce your taxable income and overall tax burden.

Why middle class feels stuck between taxes and EMIs, explains CAThe burden is not just about taxes. Price hikes on fuel, food, education, and healthcare hit the middle class the hardest. Unlike the rich, they cannot hedge against inflation with high-value assets. Unlike the poor, they don't receive government relief.
Sensex down 600 points: Why is stock market falling today?At closing bell, indices opened marginally lower but kept sliding as the day went on. Sensex and Nifty declined over half a percent.

Will life, health insurance premiums become cheaper with zero GST proposal?Will zero GST on life and health insurance truly make premiums cheaper or will input credit losses and policy design dilute the benefits for most customers? Read to know what experts have to say.
Sensex down 350 points, Nifty below 25,000; Wipro, HCLTech down 2%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 380.59 points to 81,620.12, while the NSE Nifty50 declined 127.95 points to 24,956.25 as of 9:30 am.

Dream11, MPL suspend money-based games after Online Gaming Bill clears ParliamentReal-money gaming faces a knockout blow as Dream11, MPL, and Zupee halt money-based online games. Dream11 is also likely to follow suit after sweeping ban.

Less than 40% ITRs processed as government pushes deadline to September 15The Finance Ministry has pushed the ITR deadline to 15 September citing extensive changes in forms and utilities. But three months in, processing is still crawling at under 40%.

Sensex, Nifty gain for 6th straight session on GST reforms optimismThe S&P BSE Sensex was up 142.87 points to 82,000.71 at the closing bell, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 33.20 points to settle at 25,083.75.

Key panel okays scrapping of 12%, 28% GST slabs; 90% goods may get cheaperIn a key meeting held on Thursday, the panel of state ministers accepted the Centre's plan to reduce the four-rate system to two main slabs of 5% and 18%.

How can retirees stay safe from risky 'too good to be true' schemes?Many retirees fall prey to schemes that seem too good to be true, chasing high returns without understanding the risks. Protecting your savings requires caution, awareness, and smart investment choices.

Why zero GST on insurance premiums doesn't mean cheaper policies for youOn the surface, removing GST on insurance premiums seems like a big relief, but experts caution that the outcome may not be what many are expecting.

EPFO withdrawal, pension or transfer: How to choose the right PF formEPFO members often get confused about which form to fill for withdrawals, transfers, or pension claims. Using the right form not only saves time but also avoids delays or rejection of your application.

CA explains why 80% of emergency funds don't work when neededMost people believe they are financially prepared for tough times, but when a real crisis hits, their so-called emergency funds often fall short. A chartered accountant explains why this happens and how to fix it.

Online Gaming Bill 2025: What are the different penalties in it?The Bill, which was passed in the Lok Sabha soon after it was introduced, focusses on reducing risks linked to addiction, money laundering, and misleading advertising.

No GST on life, health insurance premiums soon? Here's what it means for youA proposal has been made to exempt premiums for life and health insurance from Goods and Services Tax (GST), a move that could bring down costs and boost insurance penetration.
Sensex opens 150 points higher, Nifty above 25,000; RIL gains 1%The S&P BSE Sensex added 122.01 points to 81,979.85, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 20.45 points to 25,071.00 as of 9:23 am.

4 IPOs to close for bidding today: Which one will give you best listing gains?All four IPOs opened for subscription on August 19 and will complete allotment on August 22. The listing of these companies is scheduled for August 26 on the BSE and NSE.

Now you can buy land via a mobile app in minutes. Here's howThe initiative is intended to make land purchases easier, quicker and more transparent by using a platform that millions already rely on for daily shopping.

Will next-gen GST make homes more affordable?With the government considering a simpler two-slab GST structure, many are asking a key question: Will the new system finally make home buying more affordable?

Rapido fined Rs 10 lakh over false ads, regulator orders refunds to consumersThe penalty follows complaints that Rapido's ads such as "Guaranteed Auto" and "Auto in 5 min or get Rs 50" misled customers by creating the impression of guaranteed services.
Sensex ends 213 points higher, Nifty above 25,000; Infosys up 4%The S&P BSE Sensex gained 213.45 points to close at 81,857.84, while the NSE Nifty50 added 69.90 points to end at 25,050.55.

CA explains the risks behind 'No EMI till possession' schemesMany homebuyers are lured by "No EMI Till Possession" schemes, but a chartered accountant warns that these offers can carry hidden financial risks that may leave buyers paying for a property they never receive.

Indian-state run refiners resume Russian oil purchase amid tariff threats: ReportThe resumption of Russian oil imports by Indian state refiners could reduce supplies for top buyer China, which had stepped up purchases during their absence.

Labubu mania is back as Pop Mart shares rise by 11%, CEO predicts record salesPop Mart reported a 204% rise in revenue to 13.88 billion yuan for the first half of 2025, beating the average analyst estimate of 13.76 billion yuan. Net income jumped 397% to 4.57 billion yuan, highlighting the company's rapid growth.

Online gaming bill: Nazara Technologies and Delta Corp shares take a hitThe bill, which proposes strict rules for money-based online games and makes online betting a punishable offence, is expected to be tabled in the Lok Sabha later today.

Shifted to new tax regime? Here are 5 investments you shouldn't dropAlthough the new regime comes with lower tax rates and no exemptions, several traditional investment products continue to play a vital role in securing your finances and growing long-term wealth.

US targets Indian refiners, says richest families made excess profitsThe criticism from US is focused on India's private refiners, particularly Reliance Industries and Nayara Energy, which together account for a large share of refined fuel exports to Europe.

Ola Electric shares jump 13%, up over 20% in two sessions. Should you buy?On Tuesday, the stock climbed almost sharply after founder and chairman Bhavish Aggarwal outlined an aggressive strategy to reclaim market share and improve profitability in India's competitive EV segment.

Sensex, Nifty open lower as financial stocks offset IT gains in early tradeThe S&P BSE Sensex was down by 125.67 points to 81,518.72, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 34.50 points to 24,946.15 as of 9:33 am.

Game over for money-based online gaming? Industry in shock over proposed banIf passed in Parliament, the bill will outlaw all money-based online games (irrespective of whether they involve skill or chance), ban advertisements promoting such platforms, and bar banks and financial institutions from processing related transactions.

entertainment.headline: Khiladi Akshay, Anaari Saif reunite after 17 years as they start Haiwaan shootAfter 17 years, Akshay Kumar and Saif Ali Khan have come together once again for the upcoming film 'Haiwaan'. Helmed by Priyadarshan, the movie commenced shooting today in Kochi, Kerala.

KJo praises Siddhant, Triptii's complex roles in Dhadak 2, thanks censor boardKaran Johar, in a lengthy note, gave a shout-out to the entire team of 'Dhadak 2', including leads Siddhant Chaturvedi and Triptii Dimri.  He even thanked the censor board for their guidance.

Paradha review: An honest, non-preachy film that lays bare everyday patriarchyRelease Date:Fri Aug 22, 2025Paradha movie review: Director Praveen Kandregula's 'Paradha', starring Anupama Parameswaran, Darshana Rajendran and Sangeetha Krish, is a thoughtful film on patriarchy, women coming out of their shells and sisterhood.

25 years later, Smriti Irani and Amar Upadhyay relive their iconic Kyunki sceneActor-politician Smriti Irani's scene from 'Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi', in which Tulsi and Mihir accidentally collide, was a firm favourite among fans in the early 2000s.

Bollywood swipes right on love again: Films rediscover romance but for how long?With the latest romantic releases like 'Saiyaara', 'Metro In Dino', Bollywood is witnessing a fresh wave of romance on the big screen. Directors and actors agree that romance never truly disappeared-it just evolved with changing times.

Mouni Roy shuts down troll mocking her looks with choose better surgeon remarkActor Mouni Roy recently responded to a negative comment about her appearance on social media. The actor reacted to a troll who suggested she consult a better surgeon for her surgeries.

Hostage review: An ambitious thriller derailed by emotional histrionics and clichesRelease Date:Thu Aug 21, 2025Hostage review: The show reflects on the humane aspect of world leaders involved in geopolitical negotiations and strategic decision-making. Is the series worth your time? Here is our review.

Mohanlal thankful for Mammootty's recovery: Prayed for him at SabarimalaVeteran actor Mohanlal expressed his happiness over Mammootty's recovery amid a health scare. During the promotion of his upcoming film 'Hridayapoorvam', the actor said that he prayed for the 73-year-old in Sabarimala.

5 times Salman Khan proved no one can host Bigg Boss better than himActor Salman Khan has been hosting 'Bigg Boss' since Season 4, which aired in 2010. Over the span of 15 years, the actor has navigated through some of the biggest controversies the show has ever seen and shown how no one can host the show better than him.

Bigg Boss 19: Salman Khan hints at first contestant, fans say Awez DarbarIn a new promo video, Salman Khan teased the first contestant to enter the house. The face was not revealed, but fans guessed him as dancer Awez Darbar.

Swara Bhasker clarifies Dimple Yadav crush remark: Focus on vote theftIn an exclsuive chat with India Today, actor Swara Bhasker has clarified her comment about having a girl crush on Samajwadi Party MP Dimple Yadav amid social media backlash. She urged people to concentrate on the vote theft row instead of trolling her.

A Big Bold Beautiful Journey Trailer: Margot Robbie, Colin Farrell in an epic voyageMargot Robbie and Colin Farrell star in the romantic fantasy A Big Bold Beautiful Journey. The film explores deep emotional themes and promises a magical cinematic experience.

Bigg Boss 19 house unveiled: A vibrant cabin in woods with assembly room and no jailThe newly designed house with wooden textures, vibrant colours and many new surprises was unveiled by Bigg Boss 19 makers. A glimpse at the new house ahead of the grand premiere.

Anurag Kashyap quits drinking, says leaving Mumbai cured his depressionDirector Anurag Kashyap has moved out of Mumbai, citing negativity in Bollywood. He recently opened up on how his shift to Malayalam cinema has revived his creativity and improved his mental health.

OTT releases this week: Films, series to watch on Prime Video, JioHotstar, NetflixFrom Kajol's 'Maa' to 'The Map That Leads To You' and 'Bigg Boss 19', here is everything that will be available for streaming this weekend on OTT. Have a look at the list of all the new films and series releasing across Prime Video, JioHotstar and Netflix.

Actor Raza Murad files police complaint over death hoax, calls it shamefulVeteran actor Raza Murad has filed a police complaint after false reports of his death circulated on social media. He expressed disappointment over the fake news and called it shameful.

Behind the camera, beyond the myth: Dilip Kumar's stormy storyAshok Chopra's The Man Who Became Cinema showcases Dilip Kumar the artist, not the whole man. In 480 pages dissecting 57 films, it reveals how India's first method actor transformed Hindi cinema, while leaving the off‑screen story largely untold.
Salman Khan begins shooting Bigg Boss 19 in Galwan look. First picsActor Salman Khan looked handsome as he joined 'Bigg Boss 19' during the premiere shoot. The first photos of the show are now out.

Anemone trailer: Daniel Day-Lewis returns after 7 years in son's family reunion filmActor Daniel Day-Lewis has ended his retirement with a new role in 'Anemone', directed by his son. The film is based on a reunion between two brothers who share a complex bond with each other.

general news.headline: Big twist in Dharmasthala case, whistleblower arrested for giving false evidencePolice sources revealed that the skull initially produced by the whistleblower was fake. He was later arrested on charges of perjury and furnishing false evidence.

Never had a US President who...: S Jaishankar lays into Trump's foreign policyMinister of External Affairs S Jaishankar said he found it "funny" that those working for a "pro-business American administration" were not minding their own business and were instead "accusing others of doing business."

1 dead after cloudburst in Uttarakhand's Chamoli; Army joins rescue opsA cloudburst in Chamoli's Tharali caused massive destruction, leaving one girl dead and one person missing amid debris. Rescue teams and SDRF are carrying out relief operations as roads remain blocked.

Trump's hardline push shrinks US immigrant count by 1.5 million, 1st since 1960sWith an ageing population, the impact of this decline is also being felt in US's labour market. According to the Pew Research Centre, the workforce has lost over 750,000 workers due to the reduction in immigrant numbers.

Meet Sergio Gor, Trump's India envoy pick Elon Musk once called 'a snake'Sergio Gor is considered one of the most powerful behind-the-scenes figures in Trump's team and had reportedly played a key role in the fallout between Donald Trump and Elon Musk.

10 injured, vehicles torched as 2 groups clash in Maharashtra's KolhapurA violent clash broke out in Kolhapur's Siddharthnagar area during a football club event, leading to stone-pelting, arson, and vandalism.

Stray dog attack leaves Kanpur college student with 17 stitches on her faceA 21-year-old BBA student in Kanpur was brutally attacked by stray dogs, leaving her with severe facial injuries and 17 stitches.

Fly higher, faster: Indian astronauts gear up for Gaganyaan launchIsro will conduct the maiden launch of the uncrewed Gaganyaan mission in December 2025. The Gaganyaan program aims not only to send Indians into low-Earth orbit but also to signal the beginning of a comprehensive human spaceflight capability for the nation.

Directors and actors agree that romance never truly disappeared-it just evolved with changing times.

Mohan Yadav questions 'makhan chor' tag for Lord Krishna, Congress hits backMadhya Pradesh Chief Minister Mohan Yadav's objection to calling Lord Krishna "makhan chor" during a Janmashtami event has sparked a political row. Yadav described the term as improper, saying Krishna's fondness for butter symbolised a rebellion against Kansa.

Lionel Messi's trip to India finally confirmed, team to play friendly in KeralaLionel Messi's Argentina is set to arrive in India in November. They will play a friendly game in Kerala, the Argentine Football Association announced on Saturday, August 23.

I might get killed: Expelled Samajwadi Party MLA's letter to Akhilesh YadavPooja Pal, who was recently expelled from the Samajwadi Party, alleged that she is receiving threats and accused Akhilesh Yadav of targeting her while ignoring similar actions by senior party leaders and even members of his own family.

Why treat culture is draining Gen Z's wallets (and also their minds)Gen Z loves treating themselves on good days and bad, but these seemingly harmless, mood-boosting indulgences come with hidden costs - mental and financial.

CBI raids Anil Ambani's Mumbai home in Rs 3073-crore SBI-loan fraud caseThe CBI on Saturday raided Anil Ambani's Mumbai residence in connection with a Rs 3073 crore bank fraud case, days after ED also expanded its probe and summoned his top executives.
US man sings Indian classical thumri Aaj Khelo Shyam Sang Hori in viral videoAn American man's soulful rendition of the Indian classical thumri 'Aaj Khelo Shyam Sang Hori' has charmed the internet.
Locked in school overnight, head stuck in window grille: Class 2 girl's ordealThe incident, according to sources, occurred on Thursday in a village located in the Odisha's Keonjhar district.

The lost art of handwriting: Why pen and paper terrify so manyHandwriting may seem like a harmless task, but for many, it triggers panic, pain, and deep-rooted memories of humiliation. In India, where exams and careers still demand pen-and-paper skills, this fear creates real barriers. As digital life takes over, handwriting anxiety reveals both a generational struggle and an urgent call for recognition and change.
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

National Space Day: All that Chandrayaan-3 discovered on the MoonThe Vikram lander's seismic sensors picked up unexplained tremors, confirming the moon's tectonic activity and offering valuable data about its interior structure.

I am not giving it back: Trump's joke stumps FIFA president at White HouseUS President Donald Trump joked about keeping the FIFA World Cup trophy during a meeting with FIFA President Gianni Infantino. He refused to give the solid gold trophy back, cracking up the entire Oval Office.

Why the world is coming to India for surgeries and second chancesFrom complex cancer surgeries to joint replacements and rare orthopedic procedures, Indian hospitals are proving to be trusted destinations for global patients who have either lost hope or faced limited options at home.

India wins 4 gold, 1 silver at International Astronomy Olympiad, ranks 1India claimed four gold medals and one silver at the 18th International Olympiad on Astronomy & Astrophysics and bagged an overall Rank 1. Nearly 300 students from 64 countries competed in the Olympiad hosted in India.

Elon Musk announces Macrohard, AI-run Microsoft clone that could replace humanElon Musk has recently dropped another AI plan, which may see the light of day soon. Musk defines Macrohard, a firm that will function as a purely AI software company.

A rotten meat scandal in Kashmir is seeing restaurants dish out rajma chawalOver 12,000 kg of rotten chicken and mutton have been seized and destroyed in Jammu and Kashmir since the first week of August. Hoteliers have started offering vegetarian dishes as customer footfall sees a dip. It has severely affected them as businesses were just about turning a leaf following a lull after the Pahalgam terror attack.

Govinda greets paps with flying kisses at airport amid divorce rumours. VideoGovinda made his first public appearance amid divorce rumours. The actor-politician greeted paparazzi with a smile and blew kisses as he made his way inside the airport.

sports.headline: Rinku Singh opens up on Asia Cup selection: Did not think I would make itRinku Singh was named in India's 15-member squad for the Asia Cup 2025. Ahead of the tournament, Rinku admitted that he was not sure if he would get selected in the squad.

Won't watch IND vs PAK match, value of human life more than sports: Manoj TiwaryFormer India cricketer Manoj Tiwary has said that he won't be watching the upcoming India vs Pakistan match in the Asia Cup 2025, saying that human life is more important than sports.

Tennis a costly dream? Jannik Sinner would have quit if not ranked top 200 by 24Jannik Sinner has revealed he would have quit tennis if he had not reached the top 200 by age 24.  Sinner's comments put light on the financial struggles faced by tennis players from modest backgrounds.

WWE: Piper Niven stuns Charlotte Flair in shocking SmackDown upset of 2025SmackDown delivered a major shock as Piper Niven pinned 18-time champion Charlotte Flair in one of WWE's biggest upsets of 2025 to secure her career-defining singles win.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
